p: The differences in EPP chemical profiles observed between present and literature data can be explained on the basis of environmental and experimental conditions. Several parameters are known to influence the composition of phenolic compounds or FAs produced by the same species of algae: stage of algal growth, harvest season, geographic location, genetic diversity etc. [ 11, 13]. As an example, higher amount of high-quality phenolic compounds is generated during the hot climate and during the early stage of the growth in order to prevent the photooxidative damage and sea grazers [ 13]. In addition, also the extraction methodology (techniques, solvent, temperature, raw material) notably affect the yield of extracted compounds from a quantitative and a qualitative point of view [ 55].
